summary: This document is a chain of emails from late June to early July 2019 among FBI personnel and a forensic interviewer, scheduling a conference call to discuss victim interviews in the Jeffrey Epstein case. The emails show coordination between the FBI's New York office and the Victim Services Division, with a specific call set for June 28, 2019, at 2:00 PM Eastern Time.

connections.description: Both are involved in coordinating the conference call regarding Epstein victim interviews, indicating a professional working relationship within the FBI.

events.title: Scheduled conference call on Epstein victim interviews
events.description: An unclassified conference call was scheduled for 2:00 PM Eastern Time to discuss victim interviews in the Epstein case, involving FBI personnel from the New York office and the Victim Services Division.

events.title: Hospitalization of participant
events.description: One participant in the email chain indicates they are in the hospital and would only be able to call in for the scheduled meeting, suggesting a disruption to the planned coordination.

events.title: ADIC case brief request
events.description: The Assistant Director in Charge (ADIC) requested a case brief on Monday at 3:30 PM, leading to a hard stop at 3:20 PM for the scheduled call.

locations: FBI NY Criminal Division Violent Crimes Task Force
Seattle (mentioned as a travel location for one participant)
keyFacts: The FBI was actively coordinating victim interviews in the Jeffrey Epstein case as of late June 2019.
A conference call was scheduled for June 28, 2019, at 2:00 PM Eastern Time, involving the FBI's New York office and the Victim Services Division's Child Victim Services Unit.
The emails reference the involvement of Child/Adolescent Forensic Interviewers (CAFIs) in the Epstein investigation.
One participant was hospitalized on July 1, 2019, potentially affecting their participation in the call.
The ADIC (Assistant Director in Charge) requested a case brief on July 1, 2019, at 3:30 PM, indicating high-level oversight of the investigation.
